p: The residual milk promotes the development of SNC by acting like a culture medium leading to IMI [ 16]. Various results indicate the relevance of SNC in the occurrence of clinical and SCM in Brazilian cattle with a frequency of 8.35% of CM [ 27] and varying from 4.8 to 8.35% in SCM [ 7, 27]. Therefore, a high prevalence in the herds can be associated with a deficiency of teat disinfection practices in the pre- and post-milking routines [ 16].
